Fields.DialogueText: Morganas inbound! Let's move! Hiryū, you're on!
Banzai!
@BATTLE
That was a rough one.
Hai, I've really got to focus on my station... but did you see our Kami in action?
See her? She was in the middle of it all! Didn't even get a scratch on her.

Fields.MenuText: You're allowed to be proud. They certainly are.
Excellent work, Hiryū. You set a great example.

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate it, Kanchou. It's just...
Mochiron. It's good to see crew morale so high. But...
Arigatō gozaimasu...
Hiryū, you don't have to doubt yourself. I saw you out there shooting down Morgana shells with a rifle, of all things.
Do you eat bananas, Kanchou?
Do I... what?
Lots of target practice...
I don't know any other Belles that can put an axe into a Morgana's head from 500 meters.
Battle is like one of our dances. I feel alive and in control as in few other places...
... Except when I slip on a banana peel some careless sailor leaves lying around.
So that was that crashing sound I heard afterwards.
I am glad you are not the object of my wrath. But once drawn, it must be bloodied.
There she goes. Guess that's my last banana for the foreseeable future...
You're looking calm today.
Arigatō, Kanchou. I wanted to apologize for my earlier outburst.
Ah... well, that's all right. I'm, uh, sure it was an honest mistake on their part.
No, it's something I should be better about. You know how clumsy I can be...

Fields.MenuText: And how hard you work at being better.

Fields.DialogueText: ...Hai. As I was saying...
You are a kind person, but you know this to be true.
Then I'm certain you understand me.
My own missteps I can control and practice out of. When those of others trip me up...oh, it's so frustrating!
You feel like you shouldn't have to be looking over your shoulder on your own... on yourself.
Or keeping my eyes down, as the case may be.
Be that as it may...I hold myself to high standards. I shall not impose them unreasonably on my crew. This I vow!
As you were. I know you weren't planning on having someone flogged or something for littering.
Nevertheless, on behalf of the crew, I promise we'll all do our part not to.
...Say, you didn't actually-
Of course not, Kanchou! I ended up taking my anger out on paper. Would you care to read my latest-
*ALARM*
Later. We've got Morganas again.
@BATTLE
Hiryū, your new poem-
-Will have to wait, Kanchou! These devils must be punished!
@BATTLE
More notches in my scabbard!
As expected of the Flying Dragon. You look like you could take another scrap like that. Maybe two.
Don't tempt me, Kanchou! I find the battlefield especially invigorating of late.

Fields.MenuText: I seem to remember you're as good with a pen as with a sword.
I could do with a break myself.

Fields.DialogueText: The taste is bitter, but there is sweetness to be found.
Ah, but which is mightier? You must be ready for either answer.
We've earned one!
There is still the poetry exchange to look forward to, after all.
Yes, I've been looking forward to...
That's funny. I thought you said "exchange."
I agreed to teach you poetry, Kanchou. You didn't think I'd let you off without homework, did you?

How foolish I was.
I should have been more prepared.
You Belles and your tricks...
...Five, seven, five...I suppose you think you're quite clever!
What?
None of this false modesty! Now it's a competition...
What on earth did I just get myself into?

Lonesome spirit
In stolen body
Steals again
Thoughts, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: How long did this one take you?
Almost makes you feel bad for the Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō! I try to make them cling to the reader.
I thought a haiku always went five-seven-five.
Most do, but form is merely a guideline.
Longer than you'd think. It's as much about what not to say as what to say.
Almost.
You have to know the rules...
...To break them. It's more about feeling than structure.
Just when I think I've got the hang of it...
One step at a time. Are you ready to share yours?
Ahem...
*ALARM*
I'm going to get around to it if it kills me.
You will have your day, Kanchou. These Morganas must have theirs.
@BATTLE

Below and around
My sword and armor appears 
And sometimes beside
Ooh. That is...I see what you mean.
Thank you! I spent more time on it than I care to admit.
I...Kanchou, forgive me. That was not necessarily intended to be a compliment.
Technically, nothing, but there is more to the haiku than the technical.
Guidance, though perhaps more oblique than it should have been.
Gomen nasai. Let me explain.
If you can count and you're well-read, you can write an average haiku. But to make the reader feel as you do...that is something else entirely.
So when I write a poem about you-
-I'm flattered. But...how best to put this?
You're the teacher.
Hai...Ah! Imagine I tell you all the wonderful things waiting for you in port. Food, drink, friends...but that's it. I don't describe it. I just say it's there.
It's not the destination. It's the journey.
...Exactly. Exactly! Kanchou, I couldn't have said it better myself. Don't just tell me how powerful I am. Take me on a journey with your words.
*ALARM*
Morganas. Maybe they'll help us out.
Oh, I'll take them on a journey...
@BATTLE
I thought I'd find you out here.
Breathe, Kanchou...slowly. A day to stir the imagination, no?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe if we weren't so close to your funnels.

Fields.DialogueText: I should be asking you the same question!
For Morganas, always.
Honestly! Is that any way to speak to a lady?
But if I may be candid, Kanchou, I have rarely felt so... inspired.
The sea has that effect.

Not only the sea!
Sixty knots of lashing wind...
Even my funnels.
Like a sleeping dragon's breath,
Smoldering somewhere unseen.
Where's your pile of treasure?
Living and working below decks! They're as good as any coins for me.
And you'd breathe fire if you lost any of them.
Mm. Probably not.
No?
They are here for the same reason you and I are here, Kanchou. They pledge their lives to a greater cause. If in the course of serving it they should perish... I can think of no greater glory.
Victory might be nice.
...Morganas. Here comes our chance to fight for it.
And now you owe me a tanka!
Of course I do.
@BATTLE
At ease, sailor. Who told you to do this?
Who else? She just gave me a mop, pointed at the deck, and said-
-Mirror brightness, sailor!
Hai, Hiryū-kami-sama!

Fields.MenuText: I have to admit this corridor's never been cleaner.
Don't be so hard on them. That's my job.
I've a mind to put you to work with him.

Fields.DialogueText: I wish you could feel what I'm feeling. It's like working knots out of your muscles.
Separate spheres, Kanchou. This is my body. You are driving it.
It's been a slow day. I can be tempted.
Keeping the punishments reasonable?
Think of them as morale exercises, Kanchou. The satisfaction of a strict hygiene regimen must be instilled in the crew.
Take pride in a clean home, and you will fight to the death for it abroad. I swear I will teach them intolerance of the slightest mess!
I'm beginning to see why they call you a dragon.
There is no coin in my hoard so shiny it can't be polished. Sailor! "Brave warriors united in justice..."
"...In spirit a match for a million!"
Doesn't it just warm your heart?
*ALARM*
Above decks, Hiryū. Time for some cleaning of our own.
@BATTLE
What!?
Yes. I'm told it was a sleeping ship. No protection from the mist at all.
To take on a Morgana without a Belle... what were the crew thinking? What was the captain thinking?
Nobody could raise the captain. All they got was a broadcast of--
--The Kimigayo. Pride and patriotic fervor.
... Yes. How did you--
I feared something like this might happen. I just thought...with the Kami here, you humans might...

Fields.MenuText: We're not known for being good at waiting.

Fields.DialogueText: Who knows when that Asashio-class might have awakened?

Fields.MenuText: I just can't believe they'd be so foolish.

Fields.DialogueText: Must your people face extinction before coming together?
Unfortunately... I can.
This is just like Mukden.
An interesting comparison.
Make no mistake, Kanchou...the destiny of the Empire is bright. But deceit and arrogance are no foundation for it.
I'm glad we understand each other. That's why I wanted to speak to you before word got out. We can't have anyone else getting ideas...
Never fear. This imprudence was human. The Kami are not.
Takes a god to fight a god.
Pah! The Morganas wish they were us.
*ALARM*
Actions speak louder than words.
Then let's get loud.
@BATTLE
I've been... curious about Manchukuo for some time. I've read things censors have kept from the public. Reports. Allegations.
Ah, Hiryū, good timing. Here they come now.
I am always by your side, Kanchou. You wrote a poem about that once.
You didn't like it.
As a poem, no. But the message was appreciated.
@BATTLE
How are you holding up?
Aches, bruises...nothing I cannot walk off. I'm fine, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: What does that mean for a Belle?
That's the Hiryū I know. Good work.

Fields.DialogueText: Paint, patches...cosmetics, all. Do not worry!
The pleasure is mine!
I admit to some...frustration.
Do you ever grow tired of simply chasing these Funayūrei off?
It is certainly tempting. Rome was not built in a day, of course, and neither was Japan.
You're surprisingly patient for someone who fights so hard.
It is the only way to fight. Otherwise you end up like...like...
Are the windows fogging up?
...Those IDIOTS! Taking on the Funayūrei as if flesh and steel alone could win the day! I might have sunk them myself if I'd known their game...
Do you need a moment?
Several. This too shall pass.
How's the mourning coming?
Like a family heirloom. Given its place in the home, acknowledged, and gently pushed into the background.
You're in a poetic mood today.
Hai! It may be the most fruitful outlet for my anger.

Fields.MenuText: I should anger you more often.

Fields.DialogueText: Funny you should ask, Kanchou...
If you want steel instead of bamboo for our next spar, be my guest. Besides...
A blade only speaks one language, Kanchou. Now, then...
Don't you owe me a tanka?
Five-seven-five-seven-seven. I'm working on it, trust me.
No rush! As with battle, so with poetry.
*ALARM*
Speaking of battle...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
There you are, Hiryū. The enemy's right in our ah-whoa!
Binoculars, Kanchou. Do you see what I see?
Same as ever. Patchwork hull...wait, those pennant numbers...that can't be-
-It is. Funayūrei are scavengers. That reckless destroyer was scavenged. Along with her crew.

Fields.MenuText: Is there anything we can do?

Fields.DialogueText: I thought I'd open with a bombing run.
Always.
I see now why Westerners invented Hell.
@BATTLE
Well done.
There was nothing you could have done.
I knew this kind of foolishness had infected the Imperial Army. To think it was festering here...
All anyone can do is be ready.
If you'll excuse me, Kanchou...
Yes?
I have a ship to clean.
Looking well, Hiryū.
Do not flatter me, Kanchou. I have been cleaning since daybreak.

I can tell. The crew have, too.
I mean you, the ship.
The corridors are spotless.
Arigatō.
But something is troubling you.
The... impulse that led good sailors to seek out a Morgana fleet without a Kami of their own can happen to anyone. The only thing for it is leadership. The only thing for that is setting an example.

Fields.MenuText: Don't work yourself too hard. Rest is important too.

Fields.DialogueText: I will be the judge of that. The vitality of the Empire is my own.
I hope so.
You may stay if you like.
You don't have to do anything differently.
Don't I, Kanchou? Aboard their ship, the kanchou is second only to the Emperor himself. Authority flows from them alone if the ship herself does not weigh in.
You're suggesting that if they'd had a Belle none of this would have happened.
Sumimasen. I did not mean to impugn your judgment.
You're just thinking of what could have been done differently. I understand, Hiryū. Don't let it rule you.
Kashikomarimashita. I will not persist in it...for much longer. Give me time.
*ALARM*
In all the ways the Morganas won't. Join me on the bridge?
Of course.
Perfect. We're even on poetry, by the way. Five-seven-five-seven-seven.
"I can tell. The crew have too..." Kanchou! Come back here!
@BATTLE
Admit it. You thought it was funny.
I will grant you that I needed it. Your poetry is...how should I put it?
Like an exquisite marble sculpture of a cockroach.
You have a gift for form, I grant you.
Oh, believe me, I intend to.
Don't worry. What's important is how you're holding up. I thought I'd remind you that...well...
Life goes on.
More or less. I've never seen the crew so productive, Hiryū. And I've been taking notes on poetry while you've been... dealing with things.
I appreciate it, Kanchou. Have you ever lost someone close to you and felt powerless? Like there was something you could have done to prevent it?
Everyone does, eventually.
There was powerlessness. There was anger. They are steps on the road to acceptance. I am glad you are here to help me there.
You know I'm here if you want to talk about anything. Captain is just a title.
Not just a title.
What do you mean?
*ALARM*
You may find out. Pray you never have to.
@BATTLE
Watch and learn, Kanchou. I am in a dancing mood today!
Kimigayo?
Sinatra.
@BATTLE
One more lesson in humility for the Funayūrei!
You seem to be using that word more than you used to.
It feels more and more... correct. The old ghost stories have new dimensions now - though the yokai in the stories were never known to shell the Home Islands.

Fields.MenuText: Think of the stories they'll be telling in a hundred years.

Fields.DialogueText: No stranger than fighting alongside Belles, I would think. Spirits interact with the human world in different ways. This is just one.
Mostly tried to sink ships. Exactly what you'd expect.
As long as they end well.
I've heard every culture had different names for them. Ghost ships and sea monsters and such.
Morganas... Rusalki... It's funny. Do you remember what I said about what unites you humans?
Crisis, yes. Depressing, but true.
It doesn't only have to be that way, Kanchou. There are as many ways of explaining them as there are cultures in your world. It's like poetry for me.
I guess I hadn't thought of it that way.
Neither had the sleeping ship and her crew.
They thought they were alone against something only they could face.
...That's right. You beat me to it.
Arrogance.
Fear. I think I pity them now.
We're getting a distress signal. Are you ready?
Kanchou... this is not a distress signal. Listen.
"...See how the divine wind blows?"
Planes in the sky, Kanchou! It's happening again!
@BATTLE
Damn... she just kept coming.
So might I, if a Funayūrei prostrated herself before me.

Fields.MenuText: At least we saved the ship.
You're usually the picture of patience.
If only it were that easy.

Fields.DialogueText: They can thank us by staying far, far inland. The sea is no place for them.
When my people are threatened, the picture gets blurry.
Some legends say they'll go away if you throw matches at them. My complement of Zeros seems to work better.
It's one less ship for them to scavenge... one less crew.
Their every victory makes them stronger, Kanchou. It is the only reason I suffer fools and cowards. The Funayūrei use them better, for they are neither.
Their escort will be here soon enough. They'll be out of our sight before long.
The arrogance of them...
I'd better leave her alone.
Another unawoken ship on a suicide run? Dammit - full speed to intercept!
What's that sound...?
Kanchou. Join me below decks?
*ALARM*
It'll-
-Have to wait. Let us proceed.
@BATTLE
Listen again. Do you hear?
That sounds like...Sinatra?
Another new one. It's called "My Buddy." I secured a copy through HQ.
Only my friend there can read the code I wrote in. It was hidden in a copy of the Kokutai no Hongi. I do have a reputation to uphold.
With your assistance.

Fields.MenuText: Never pegged you for the sentimental type.

Fields.DialogueText: Even dragons can weep.
It's been a while since I-
Good. We're on the same page. Besides, the rhythm helps me think.
You're still thinking about the sleeping ships?
I have been turning over an idea in my head... one that might give any would-be heroes pause.
What did I say about flogging?
Kanchou, honestly! I'm not one of those German Kami.
So what do you have in mind?
I'll need to give it more thought. Spin me.
There are the Morganas. Is the plane ready?
All set.
Is its pilot?
He seemed quite happy to go.
He'd better.
@BATTLE
Now we wait.
We find another fool to deploy.
I hope so. I would hate to have to do this a second time.

Fields.MenuText: I'm surprised you'd come up with this.

Fields.DialogueText: It was nothing he wouldn't have attempted. I merely enabled him.
So he'll tail this Morgana and take photographs for us. Then it's off to the Asahi Shimbun.
For many, the concept of sacrifice is an abstraction. We should show them exactly what they're risking. There is no honor in being taken by the enemy.
He knows this.
High risk, high reward. I just hope it doesn't backfire.
Is that the Asahi Shimbun?
Our Asahi Shimbun. It's the talk of the homeland.
I take it your plan worked.
Prince Hiroyasu himself said any unilateral actions would be treated as tantamount to treason, win or lose.
The Marshal Admiral. Doesn't get much higher than that.
I also requested and received a dossier on Japanese casualties at Nomonhan - following up on an old conversation. An even more glorious waste.

Fields.MenuText: And now there's peace with the Soviets.
If only the Army had Belles.

Fields.DialogueText: What would they be? Tanks? Guns? And just think of what they'd be fighting.
Which gives us time to settle down and prepare, the way we should have kept on doing in the summer. Until we were ready.
Least of all from themselves.
"You have to know the rules to break them..." They didn't even have a clue what they were facing. Or if they did, they didn't care.
The sleeping ships?
And the Kantō-gun at Nomonhan. I cannot fight both the Morganas and my own people.
I'm not going to tell you to let it go. I don't even know if you can make that decision. But we're all safer with you fighting for us.
It's not enough!
We'll find out when we get there.
Kanchou...
I don't know anyone who's given more of themselves than you to the war effort. It's a bigger war than any battle we fight. You're doing yours right.
Intellectually, I know you're right, and I appreciate it. I will just...I need time.
Granted.
There they are again. Are you ready?
Are the crew ready?
They've all been called to action stations. They know what they're up against.
I wish to say something to them, if I might.
The radio's yours.
Ahem...You have served aboard me faithfully and industriously. I know each and every one of you for an honored - or honorary - sailor of the Imperial Navy.
We face an enemy that would use that honor against us. Our ships, our very people, shackled to their fell designs. What is lost can only be returned to us in fire and perseverance.
I am the Emperor's will made manifest. Know that at my shoulder your purpose is certain. Ours is to fulfill it.

Fields.MenuText: Stirring. You should do that more often.
Did you just come up with that?

Fields.DialogueText: As often as I must.
If you choose to look at it that way.
No. Between you and me... Sinatra-san is inspiring writing music.
I can give the crew all the lectures and chores in the world, but it is pure narcissism if I do not lead by example on the battlefield.
I get it. There's building character, and then there's showing them what they've chosen to take pride in.
Like you, Kanchou. I know if I were to be defeated, you would not hesitate to destroy me before the enemy could enslave me.
...Run that by me again?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
It's been ages since we sparred.
Your footwork shows, Kanchou! Hah!
Got you!
Aah!
This only proves what a good teacher I am.
I have yet to face an injury I could not.
I will always accept one.
While we're here... you can tell me what you meant the other day.
About what I trust you to do if I am compromised?
You're a great soldier, Hiryū. Even if that happened, there's always another way.
It doesn't matter how it happens. What matters is that it could.
You're my friend, Hiryū. I'm not going to-
That is precisely the reason I trust you to do what is right!
*ALARM*
Not today.
Hai.
@BATTLE
Hiryū, do you have a moment?
Mochiron, Kanchou. Always.
*Cough cough* This incense is really something.
I can open some windows. I've been thinking long enough.

Fields.MenuText: You seemed to have your mind made up.

Fields.DialogueText: I insist. Part of being a Belle is sharing myself.
I still do.
What I said to you about... the war.
I realize it is an... unconventional thing to ask of a human.
That's one way of putting it.
I cannot be other than what I am. But even if I weren't a Kami, I would still embody the Emperor's will. It's my duty. To have it thwarted, let alone subverted, is unthinkable.
You'd rather die?
How is it that I live, Kanchou? We Belles came into being after the Morganas appeared. Our purpose and our origin are the same.
Who is to say another calamity may not bring us back in one form or another? If I am born to defend something beautiful... let me die defending it. I will not risk being turned against my country.
There's no persuading you otherwise, is there? No finding a way to... to...
If there is some sort of purification ritual against the Morganas, I have yet to find it.
*ALARM*
Until then, fire will have to do.
@BATTLE
Ohayo gozaimasu!
Hiryū, good morning. You're looking at ease.
My melancholy has passed, Kanchou. I have come to apologize once more.

Fields.MenuText: It's going to take me a while to accept this.

Fields.DialogueText: What I said remains true. But I have neglected your lessons.
Then I will work to give you all the time in the world.
I could not bear otherwise.
It has been a while since we exchanged poetry, has it not?
I'll have you know I've built up something of a portfolio.
How exciting! Where shall we begin?
*ALARM*
After we've finished up here. Join me for a drink?
I would love nothing more.
@BATTLE

The moon hides the sun
Beautiful yet terrible
Blinding to see, but...
If one were to look away
The shade would be cool and dark
Mmm.
Better?
Congratulations, Kanchou. You are one of a very few to give an aircraft carrier chills.

Fields.MenuText: Nor will I be the last.

Fields.DialogueText: There is indeed an element of acceptance about it.
There is still so much to learn, so much to see of this world, after all.
It's not what was said, Kanchou. It was the way you said it.
Well, go on then. It's your turn.
Hai. Ahem...

My home stands proudly
Above the fields that feed it
Beneath shelt'ring skies
Waiting for the day to come
When it may repay its debt.
I think we've been worried about the same thing lately.
If for different reasons. You liked it?
It puts things in perspective. Makes one want to live in the moment, rather than dreading what comes after. That's what you're getting at, right?
Knowing the rules, and breaking them until you must stop.
*ALARM*
Perfect timing for once.
@BATTLE
Well, I think I can make out a few scraps of our lost destroyer incorporated into that hull over there - but I think this has to be the end of the Morgana group that took her down.
Hai, Kanchou. Soon she should finally be able to rest.
Whenever you're ready.
@BATTLE
What was that radio interference toward the end?
You wouldn't have understood, Kanchou. The Kami and the Funayūrei share a language...somehow.
It's not simply words, but... feelings. I wish I had a better way to describe it.
If she had wanted any of you humans to hear, she would have spoken to you. You are lucky.
Things I am getting better at ignoring.
Hiryū... are you--
Scuttle me, Kanchou.
What!?
Not today. Perhaps not ever. But if she were to defeat me... I would watch you fight on from the bottom of the ocean before ever turning against you.
... I don't understand.
Kanchou--
I don't need to.
What--
And I don't have to like it. But if it comes to that... I swear I will be the one to give the order. I owe a friend that much for teaching me her ways.
Arigatō. I am proud to call you my kanchou... my friend.
Have you been listening to the crew lately?
I've been watching them. There's a real... I guess you could call it urgency... in their work.
I suppose there is. I've been paying more attention to the stories they tell.

Fields.MenuText: Ensign Asquith insists she saw you put out a Morgana's eyes. Firing from the hip.
Some of the pilots swear you talk to them mid-flight.

Fields.DialogueText: It's not what's said...it's how it's said.
My planes may not speak as I do... but they have voices of their own. Even if you don't know you're listening.
She's a flatterer. I used my iron sights for that.
It gives you hope, doesn't it?
It gives them hope. I think that's exactly what the sleeping ships' crews lacked.
Even with Belles fighting elsewhere?
Hearing about it is one thing. Seeing is another.
Here's hoping.
No need to hope. Wherever they are, there shall we be, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
Case conveniently in point.
After you, Kanchou. No bananas this time?
... How did you-
I didn't. Now I am certain.
Hiryū, I apologize. I should have-
Look at you blushing over a silly banana peel! Consider us even, Kanchou. I certainly do.
@BATTLE
